data.title: Wonderful Customer Service! Wonderful Food!
data.text: My daughter and I just ate here today and fell in love with Hot and Cold Cafe.  The owner is an absolute delight who takes pride in his food.  We enjoyed every bite and will go back again!

data.title: Great food, Service and Scenery
data.text: My wife and I have been here twice and had great experiences. The food was fantastic and the owner was very welcoming and hospitable. I would suggest eating the buffet and if they have the tomato soup, you must try it! Delicious!

data.title: Great Indian
data.text: Great Indian food and the owner will bend over backwards for you.  The Buffet allows you to try all sorts of new things.  Can't speak to the Mediterranean options.

data.title: Less than we expected
data.text:
We ordered tabouli, a bulgar wheat salad which was flavorful, but a little dry, though we'd order it again.  We each had the gyros. They are not Greek with onions/cucumber tzatziki sauce on a pita; they are Lebanese with tomato and shredded lettuce on a flat bread. The meat was not sausage from a rotary spit, but marinated lamb meat, a bit dry.  It was flavorful, however, not what we had hoped for. So we're on the hunt for good Greek gyros, which we haven't found in Lynchburg. I would not order these again.
For dessert, we chose kheer and chocolate baklava. The kheer was really wonderful and baklava never disappoints.
This restaurant is located in a nice location downtown. Take a walk up Monument Terrace just up the street.  The atmosphere is casual with quite a few people at lunchtime, many eating the Indian buffet.  The constant chatter of the waitress was unpleasant; she talked the entire time we were there, leaving little time to ourselves.

data.title: low prices but excellent food
data.text: Not fancy but the owner is very friendly and makes excellent middle eastern food, mostly from India. They have been in business for over 6 years. The lunch buffet is always good.

data.title: Great Lunch Buffet!
data.text: My wife and I had passed this restaurant a couple of times and thought the aromas as we passed were inviting. We passed by again at lunch time and decided to give it a try. Although we are not big fans of buffet, it offered a nice selection and seemed like a great way to sample what they had to offer. Good Choice! the selections were well seasoned, particularly since my wife likes mild flavors and I like blazing. They had a couple of house made condiments, one onion and one mixed vegetable. The former was mild and tasty and the latter allowed me to spice up my selections as I like it. The owner and his wife were very congenial and eager to please. There were so many items on the menu that we promised each other that we would come back and try some but we fear that the buffet will beckon to us again. A great place for a casual meal with well prepared, fresh food. Not a combination that one finds frequently in today's restaurants. I will definitely be back for the lamb vindaloo, one of my favorites.

data.title: Personable, delicious and relaxed
data.text: Locally owned small cafe with delicious food and very charismatic owners.  It was like being welcomed into a friend's home, caring about your experience and making sure you were satisfied with your meal.  These owners offer a friendly, relaxed, enjoyable dining experience.

data.title: So fun!
data.text: This Saturday we came I. And even though it was really quiet on the street, this place was packed. And there's a good reason. The food was fantastic and the owners were so concerned that we had a good experience. We did indeed!

data.title: Mouthy owners
data.text:
This was by far one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. It reminds me of a restaurant that needs to be on kitchen nightmares.
I orded a wrap to go. It was horrendous. The wrap was stale, the chips were stale and the ingredients weren't very fresh. They advertise their 'amazing vegetarian selection' but I've experienced many other places with much more vegetarian friendly choices. Really, they advertise being able to take out ingredients which are not vegetarian but any other place has this ability too. I didn't find it to be any more affordable either. 
But by far, my main problem were the owners. They do not stop talking to you. They tried twice to convince me to get a meal that I didn't want even after I told them what I wanted to order. The woman talked with me whilst the food was being prepared which was understandable but she would not allow me to leave even 10 minutes after I received my food. I was hoping for a quick grab and go experience. She was very invasive and talked to you as if you were her long time friend which I found inappropriate. For example, I saw her go into a customer's booth whilst they were eating and talk to them.
Overall, would not return or recommend. Do yourself a favour and stay away.

data.title: lunch in downtown lynchburg
data.text: I love this place.for lunch they have a small buffet area where you can serve your self.They have one of the best cucumber salads around that is always fresh unlike some places.They always bring out a special hot sauce for me when i go in. I like it spicy.

data.title: A True Taste of Indian Food
data.text: My wife and I ate at this restaurant today and we are still raving about the excellent food.  We found the place thanks to TripAdvisor, love Indian food and thought we'd give it a try.  We had the buffet which had 2 types of rice, two veggie dishes and a chicken dish which were all mild in flavor.  We added a hot relish/sauce on the side and mixed in and got the zing we were looking for!  There were 2 salads - one Mediterranean and one Indian plus fresh fruit and to-die-for mango pudding.  I added parantha which  was exactly like what I had when in India plus hot chai.  My wife had the buffet and cold chai tea plus homemade mango ice cream!!!  Oh my goodness - it was soooo good.  The owner and his wife made us feel like we were eating at their dining table - good conversation, making sure we had what we needed and lots of laughs.  This is not a fancy, big place - what is outstanding is the quality of the food.  No preservatives, no pretend pre-packaged food, just great and tasty Indian cuisine.  We live about an hour away and plan to make this our new favorite restaurant!

data.title: Wonderful Indian and Mediterranean Restaurant
data.text: My wife and I were traveling through Lynchburg and decided to stop here based on the positive reviews.  The chicken tikka masala was delicious, as was the lamb curry.  There are many dessert choices.  We chose the walnut baklava and mango pudding which were excellent. The owner is customer focused and couldn't have been more pleased with our visit.

data.title: Delightful hospitality and cuisine
data.text: Great find. Wonderful fresh tasty authentic nourishment for mind and body. Enjoyed the owners. Great suggestions. Had the lamb Subji. Lamb is quality not gamey.

data.title: Great family meal
data.text: I went on Saturday evening with my husband, our two young boys, my husband's cousin.  We all enjoyed the meal and the personal service very much. The owners were very hospitable and the food was very good! We especially enjoyed the pudding desserts and the dal and chicken curry.  The hummus was also very good.  A very local place, not fancy, but great for the family.

data.title: Authentic food, with reasonable prices, and the best service.
data.text: I went last winter with my girlfriend later in the evening. We happened to be the only two people in there with the owner. We tried a lamb gyro plate and falafel plate. Both meals were easily the best gyros and falafel's we've ever tried. We even got some hummus to go with the meal. He was making fresh hummus that night and after serving us an entire plate of hummus, provided an extra bit of the fresh stuff he had just finished making so that we could compare. The older batch was well marinated and very delightful, while the fresh stuff had a bit of a bolder taste to it. Either way, all of these dishes were the best I have tried. I then decided to go to their weekend buffet, and tried everything on the menu. There wasn't as much of a selection as some other buffets, but everything was incredibly tasty and fresh. Spice was available if you desired it, and of course, baklava for dessert!

data.title: An Authentic Little Spot
data.text: The lunch buffet is small but delicious, and nothing is pre-made.  The owner makes the food from scratch and he'll welcome you with a smile when you arrive.  Great Indian cuisine.

data.title: Wonderful food served with great hospitality
data.text: This restaurant is an absolute gem tucked away in just a couple doors off of Main Street in Lynchburg.  The husband and wife team that own this were cook and waitress the night we stopped for a hot beverage and snack, and what a great team they are!  The hot tea was perfect - nicely spiced and brewed there, not just a tea bag dunked in hot water.  We ended up ordering food, and it was a treat.I cna't remember the name of the dish with lamb, but it was great!  Desert was baklava for me (but not the sticky-sweet kind; this had cocoa in the layers and it was GOOD!  The owner brought us some of the mango pudding to try.  Like everything else, it was very tasty.  Would love to be in town someday at lunch time and try the lunch buffet.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Great food. Great hosts.
data.text:
On a recent visit to Lynchburg I ended up with some extra time to spend.  My two sons, future daughter-in-law and I explored some of the antique shops on Main Street, and were looking to get a warm drink at the end of the day.

We were warmly greeted when we entered, seated and given a menu.  The cuisine is Indian-Mediterranean, and the menu items were described for us.  I started off with a cup of hot tea, and it was great!  It was fresh brewed (not from a tea bag) and nicely spiced with cardomom and some other nice warming spices.  It was so good I had a second cup, and after tasting mine, one of my kids ordered a cup.  We went ahead and ordered some gyro wraps, and they were great.  For desert, we tried the baklava.  It was great, with a hint of cocoa!  After the meal we were brought a mango pudding to sample.  Again, it was delicious, and unlike anything we have had before.

It turns out that the couple that we were interacting with were the owners!  They are very friendly, and we will definitely be going back when we are in Lynchburg!  They do a lunch buffet that I really want to try.

data.title: Wonderful rest stop!
data.text: The owner is extremely personable and the baba ganoush is fantastic (very garlicky!).  We stopped on a road trip for vegetarian food.

data.title: Went for the buffet so we could try different dishes
data.text: Went to the Hot and Cold Café for lunch on the 28th for something different in Lynchburg.  The buffet was limited with only 1 meat dish, but there were a total of around 8-10 things to sample and it included custard for dessert.  All of the items we sampled were very tasty and I would go again just to be downtown on Main Street.  The owner made the difference here by being so friendly and ready to please with different breads and hot sauces.
